content.description: Sit start bottom right part of Arete. V5 start a few moves in.
content.protection: 1 or maybe a second pad for the rock behind you as well as a towel to stand on prior to the start.
content.location: The arete start to right hand man.

content.description: This problem starts off under an overhang sit start; you're given a left-hand side pull nub and a right hand undercling. Suck it up and smack the SLOPEY arete with right hand. Takes lots of power to stick the first move (I found that the crux). Work your way up the slopey arete basically fighting to stay on until you reach the top and turn the corner.
content.protection: safe fall zone. Maybe a pad or two to be extra safe.
content.location: See Supertopo's Bay Area Bouldering guide

content.description: On the uphill corner of the boulder, right of Gray Face. There's a picture of this on the cover of the 1995 edition to the guidebook. Fun, committing moves up high...
content.location: On the uphill corner of the boulder, right of Gray Face.

content.description: This Traverse is one of the best in the bay. Starts on the far right (if facing the rock) and traverses uphill. Finish in the massive hueco by the tree or continue straight up for full value and a spicy topout.
content.protection: May want pads if you are going to top out the highball ending. Watch out for the tree!
content.location: Two ways to get there. Easy to get lost. See Bay Area Bouldering by Super Topo.

content.description: Sit start and climb the obvious overhang via dynamic moves. One of the top out holds is really sharp and might bite! Other than the sharp hold which keeps it from being a classic in my opinion, it's a great line!
content.protection: 1 pad or two pads mainly to keep your shoes dirt free, and some tough skin for the top out!
content.location: Around the corner coming from "Right Hand Man" and just up the hill from "Coz Solo". Can't miss it!

content.description: Left of Abu Nidal Cranks A Rad, on the same boulder. Committing moves with an awkward landing.
content.location: Left of Abu Nidal Cranks A Rad, on the same boulder.

content.description: A fun lieback crack left of Coz Solo that finishes on Coz Solo
Somewhat high, with a bad landing. The crux is mostly in your head... Watch for loose holds, as this line doesn't get done very often.
content.location: On a smaller boulder just behind Achielle Larro. If you're facing AE head-on, this boulder is behind you and to your left.

content.description: Ascends the face ~15' right of Achielle Larro (opposite from Center Crack). Straight up through good holds. This is a little bit highball, but fun.
content.location: 15' right of Achielle Larro (opposite from Center Crack)

content.description: The burly ending to the "Klinghoffer Traverse". Stand start matched on the sloper pocket and dyno to the hueco jug. Move up to the horn and pinchable fin. From here grab a small crimp or undercling with your left hand and do a scary dyno to the obvious sloper jug. Might want to hang a pad from the tree in the landing zone!
content.protection: 1 or two pads (I hung one from the tree in the landing zone but you usually land without hitting the tree)
content.location: The topout ending of Klinghoffers traverse.

content.description: Short, but somewhat difficult moves, topping out with your back in the tree branches (assuming nothing has changed -it's been a while since I've been there.
Start right of the lieback crack and solo up to a scary top out.
content.protection: Pads might help but you will definitely break your legs, you probably won't die but you won't be able to walk out if you fall close to the top. Bolts on Top!
content.location: The big boulder around the corner to left downhill past the overhang

content.description:
Ascend the face 20 feet or so left/uphill from the start of Achielle Larro, at a shallow crack.

This was rated 5.9 in the 1988 guidebook, and 5.10a in more recent books.

If you avoid the crack holds, the same line goes at around V1.
content.location: 20' left/uphill from Achielle Larro, on the same boulder.

content.description: Stand start on the sloper, get a heel and mantle to get to the sloper up and left.
content.location: The boulder forming a cave like entrance to the Klinghoffers Traverse.

content.description: start on a arete pinch hold for the right hand and a low left hand undercling and move through the obvious holds to a jug. Top out around the corners or reach over the moss to the back of the boulder and top out. Fun little problem with a ton of moss at the top. Good warmup! Note: there are 3 different top out options.
content.location: Before the little cave right before the traverse if approaching the Achille Lauro or Right Hand Man/around the corner/behind the Right Hand Man landing zone on the mossy boulder from where you can see Klinghoffers traverse.

content.description: Balancy Arete with a little of a psychological factor. Try not to barn-door.
content.protection: pads definitely needed and spotter encouraged

content.description: Kind of hairball, but worth a look. Watch for loose holds, as this line doesn't get climbed often.
content.location: On the same boulder as Head Hunter, and 10' left of that line.
